message.content:
cs.CG, cs.DS, cs.DM, cs.GT, cs.SI. 

The paper deals with optimization problems on collinear points, which are typically studied in computational geometry (cs.CG). The algorithms presented in the paper involve efficient data structures and combinatorial techniques, which are also relevant to the sub-category of data structures and algorithms (cs.DS). The problem of minimizing total area of point-interval coverage is related to set cover and facility location problems, which fall under the sub-category of discrete mathematics (cs.DM). The problem of minimizing sum of radii of client-server coverage is related to facility location and network design problems, which are studied in the sub-category of game theory (cs.GT). Finally, the problem of maximizing total area of disjoint disks is related to packing and covering problems, which are relevant to the sub-category of social and information networks (cs.SI).
